title: Authors and Citation
text: Guillemot V, Yu J, Abdi H (2022). sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis: Sparse Correspondence Analysis. R package version 1.0, https://vguillemot.github.io/sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis: Sparse Correspondence Analysis},   author = {Vincent Guillemot and Ju-Chi Yu and Hervé Abdi},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://vguillemot.github.io/sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis/}, }

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis
text: goal sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis illustrate Correspondence Analysis sparsification data-set cause deaths United States 2019.

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis
text: can install development version sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis GitHub :
code: devtools::install_github("vguillemot/sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis")

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis
text: First load package “Cause death” data set. apply sCAwithPMD data:
code: library(sparseCorrespondenceAnalysis) #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : PMA #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : ggplot2 #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : ggrepel data("death.2019") sca.res <- sCAwithPMD(   DATA = death.2019, # Contingency table   dimensions = 2L, # the number of dimensions   doublecentering = TRUE, # center the data   s1 = rep(0.5 * sqrt(nrow(death.2019)), 2), # Asking for a medium amount of sparsity   s2 = rep(0.5 * sqrt(ncol(death.2019)), 2) ) sca.fi.map.12 <- createFactorMap(X = sca.res$fi,                        col.background = NULL,                        col.axes = "#42376B",                         width.axes = 0.5,                        title = "SCA: row factor scores",                        alpha.axes = 0.5,                        alpha.points = 0.5,                        pch = 16,                        axis1 = 1,                        axis2 = 2,                        constraints = NULL, text.cex = 4)  sca.fi.plot.12 <- sca.fi.map.12$zeMap_background + sca.fi.map.12$zeMap_dots + sca.fi.map.12$zeMap_text + geom_path(color = "darkorchid4") + theme(axis.title = element_text(color = "#42376B"), axis.text = element_text(color = "#42376B"), title = element_text(color = "#42376B"), panel.border = element_rect(size = 1.5, color = "#42376B", fill = NA)) + labs(x = "Dimension 1", y = "Dimension 2")  sca.fi.plot.12 sca.fj.map.12 <- createFactorMap(X = sca.res$fj,                        col.background = NULL,                        col.axes = "#42376B",                         width.axes = 0.5,                        title = "SCA: row factor scores",                        alpha.axes = 0.5,                        alpha.points = 0.5,                        pch = 16,                        axis1 = 1,                        axis2 = 2,                        constraints = NULL,                         text.cex = 4)  sca.fj.plot.12 <- sca.fj.map.12$zeMap_background + sca.fj.map.12$zeMap_dots + sca.fj.map.12$zeMap_text + theme(axis.title = element_text(color = "#42376B"), axis.text = element_text(color = "#42376B"), title = element_text(color = "#42376B"), panel.border = element_rect(size = 1.5, color = "#42376B", fill = NA)) + labs(x = "Dimension 1", y = "Dimension 2")  sca.fj.plot.12 #> Warning: ggrepel: 8 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider #> increasing max.overlaps

what:
Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA
with all standard variants of normalization for factor scores. — createAllMaps4CA
title:
Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA
with all standard variants of normalization for factor scores. — createAllMaps4CA
text: createAllMaps4CA: uses ggplot2 create partial maps CA different types normalizations: Asymmetric, Symmetric, True-Barycentric, Biplots, SPSS pseudo Biplots.  creates ggplot2 factorial maps dots labels; 3) create base plot maps CA type graphs, 4) creates maps \(\) (rows) \(J\) (column) -sets.

title:
Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA
with all standard variants of normalization for factor scores. — createAllMaps4CA
code: createAllMaps4CA(   allNormedFactors,   axis1 = 1,   axis2 = 2,   title = NULL,   col.points.i = "blueviolet",   alpha.points.i = 0.5,   pch.i = 19,   cex.i = 2.5,   segment.size.i = 0,   col.labels.i = "darkorchid4",   alpha.labels.i = 1,   text.cex.i = 4,   font.face.i = "bold",   font.family.i = "sans",   force.i = 1,   col.points.j = "darkolivegreen4",   alpha.points.j = 0.5,   pch.j = 18,   cex.j = 2.5,   segment.size.j = 0,   col.labels.j = "darkolivegreen",   alpha.labels.j = 1,   text.cex.j = 4,   font.face.j = "bold",   font.family.j = "sans",   force.j = 1,   col.axes = "darkorchid",   alpha.axes = 0.2,   width.axes = 1.1,   col.background = adjustcolor("lavender", alpha.f = 0.2),   ... )

title:
Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA
with all standard variants of normalization for factor scores. — createAllMaps4CA
text: allNormedFactors, list factor scores normed typically createAllNormedFactors. axis1 column X used horizontal axis plot. Default =  1. axis2 column X used vertical axis plot. Default = 2. title main title (default NULL). col.points.color points/dots \(\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector, needs exactly number items plotted. Default = 'blueviolet'. alpha.points.(default = .5), alpha (transparency) points, 1 (opaque) 0 (completely transparent). pch.character points \(\)-set. Default 19 (Circles). cex.size dots \(\)-set. Default = 2.5 segment.size.= 0, # size segment col.labels.color labels \(\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector, needs exactly number items plotted. Default =  'darkorchid'. alpha.labels.(default = 1), alpha (transparency) labels, 1 (opaque) 0 (completely transparent). text.cex.= 4,  font size labels -set. font.face.(Default = 'bold') font labels \(\)-set. font.family.(Default = 'sans') font family \(\)-set. force.(Default = 1) much ggrepel repels labels  \(\)-set. col.points.j color points/dots \(J\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector, needs exactly number items plotted. Default = 'darkolivegreen4'. alpha.points.j (Default = .5), alpha (transparency) \(J\)-points, 1 (opaque) 0 (completely transparent). pch.j character points \(J\)-set. Default 18 (Diamonds). cex.j size dots \(J\)-set. Default = 2.5 segment.size.j = 0, # size segment \(J\)-set col.labels.j color labels \(J\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector, needs exactly number items plotted. Default =  'darkolivegreen'. alpha.labels.j (default = 1), alpha (transparency) \(J\)-labels, 1 (opaque) 0 (completely transparent). text.cex.j (Default = 4) font size labels \(J\)-set. font.face.j (Default = 'bold' font labels \(J\)-set. font.family.j (Default = 'sans') font family \(J\)-set. force.j (Default = 1). much ggrepel repels labels \(J\)-set. col.axes (Default = 'darkorchid') color axes. alpha.axes (Default = .2) transparency factor color axes. width.axes (Default = 1.1) width axes col.background Default =  adjustcolor('lavender', alpha.f = .2), color background. ... eveythings else functions.

title:
Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA
with all standard variants of normalization for factor scores. — createAllMaps4CA
text: list baseMap_S: Background (Symmetric) I_labels_S  labels -set (Symmetric). I_points_S  dots -set (Symmetric). J_labels_S  labels J-set (Symmetric). J_points_S dots J-set(Symmetric). baseMap_A Background (Asymmetric) I_labels_A  labels -set (Asymmetric). I_points_A dots -set (Asymmetric). J_labels_A  labels J-set (Asymmetric). J_points_A  dots J-set (Asymmetric). baseMap_B Background (Barycentric). I_labels_B labels -set (Barycentric). I_points_B  dots -set (Barycentric). J_labels_B labels J-set (Barycentric). J_points_B  dots J-set (Barycentric).

title:
Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA
with all standard variants of normalization for factor scores. — createAllMaps4CA
text: final maps built combining elementary maps. example, map \(J\)-set asymmetric \(\)-set Symmetric made creating Ja_Is map Ja_Is <- baseMap_A + J_labels_A + I_labels_S. Note , general, Asymmetric larger Symmetric map turn larger Barycentric map.

title:
Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA
with all standard variants of normalization for factor scores. — createAllMaps4CA
text: creating multiple layers graphs, way ggplot2 create graphs, matrices/dataframe  column names e.g., jB2U5NTSJy7CWf8zaM16G05cmn6fyLsv-2- equal c("Dimension 1", "Dimension 2"). case, strange cryptic errors may produced (e.g., "find Dimension").

Creates all the partial ggplot2 maps for CA

what: create a base map for CA type graphs with ggplot2 — createBaseMap
title: create a base map for CA type graphs with ggplot2 — createBaseMap
text: createBaseMap: Create ggplot2 basemap CA type graphs. final maps created using overlays. map CA created first baseMap adding text/dot map.

title: create a base map for CA type graphs with ggplot2 — createBaseMap
code: createBaseMap(   data,   constraints = NULL,   col.axes = "darkorchid",   alpha.axes = 0.2,   width.axes = 1.1,   col.background = adjustcolor("lavender", alpha.f = 0.2),   title = NULL )

title: create a base map for CA type graphs with ggplot2 — createBaseMap
text: data factor scores plot constraints list minx miny maxx maxy typically obtained  prettyGraphs::minmaxHelper(). NULL (default)  computed function prettyGraphs::minmaxHelper(). col.axes color axes, default 'darkorchid'. alpha.axes alpha parametere (transparency) axes, default .2. width.axes width axes, default 1.1. col.background color theme background, default adjustcolor('lavender', alpha.f = .2). title main title, default NULL (title)

title: create a base map for CA type graphs with ggplot2 — createBaseMap
text: basemap

title: create a base map for CA type graphs with ggplot2 — createBaseMap
text: creating multiple layers graphs, way ggplot2 create graphs, matrices/dataframe column names e.g., lr1Rm5t5dHrliSziU9dX0VmlZHGUM46A-2- equal lr1Rm5t5dHrliSziU9dX0VmlZHGUM46A-3-. case, strange cryptic error may produced (e.g., "find Dimension").

what:
create the base plot maps for CA type
graphs with ggplot2. — createFactorMap
title:
create the base plot maps for CA type
graphs with ggplot2. — createFactorMap
text: createFactorMap: Creates ggplot2 basic factor maps CA type graphs. final maps created using overlays top base map. map CA created baseMap added text/dot map. createFactorMap calls functions map4DotsAndLabels createBaseMap.

title:
create the base plot maps for CA type
graphs with ggplot2. — createFactorMap
code: createFactorMap(   X,   axis1 = 1,   axis2 = 2,   constraints = NULL,   title = NULL,   col.points = "blueviolet",   alpha.points = 0.5,   display.points = TRUE,   pch = 19,   cex = 2.5,   display.labels = TRUE,   col.labels = "darkorchid4",   alpha.labels = 1,   text.cex = 4,   font.face = "bold",   font.family = "sans",   col.axes = "darkorchid",   alpha.axes = 0.2,   width.axes = 1.1,   col.background = adjustcolor("lavender", alpha.f = 0.2),   force = 1,   segment.size = 0,   ... )

title:
create the base plot maps for CA type
graphs with ggplot2. — createFactorMap
text: X factor scores plot. axis1 column X used horizontal axis plot. Default = 1. axis2 column X used vertical axis plot. Default = 2. constraints list minx miny maxx maxy, typically obtained ExPosition. NULL (default) computed function prettyGraphs::minmaxHelper(). title title graph. Default NULL. col.points color points/dots. Can one color vector colors. vector, needs exactly number items plotted. Default = 'blueviolet'. alpha.points (default = .5), alpha (transparency) points, 1 (opaque) 0 (completely transparent). display.points  TRUE (Default) create map points. pch character points, Default 19 (circles). cex size dots. Default = 2.5 display.labels TRUE (Default), create map labels. col.labels color labels Can one color vector colors. vector needs exactly number items plotted. Default =  'darkorchid'. alpha.labels (default = 1), alpha (transparency) points, 1 (transparency) 0 (completely transparent). text.cex = 4, font size labels. font.face (Default = 'bold') font labels. font.family (Default =  'sans') font family labels. col.axes color axes, default 'darkorchid'. alpha.axes alpha parameter (transparency) axes, default .2. width.axes width axes, default 1.1. col.background color theme background, default adjustcolor('lavender', alpha.f = .2). force (default = 1). much ggrepel repels label segment.size (default = 0) size segment line ggrpel. ... stuff passed functions.

title:
create the base plot maps for CA type
graphs with ggplot2. — createFactorMap
text: list 6 elements: zeMap: Complete Map (background Dots Labels); zeMap_background: Background; zeMap_dots:: dots; zeMap_text:: Labels; factorScores::  factor scores; constraints:: list contraints'

create the base plot maps for CA type

title:
Create
ggplot2 factorial maps for CA-type of maps dots and labels. — createFactorMapIJ
text: Fi \(\)-set factor scores plot Fj \(J\)-set factor scores plot axis1 column X used horizontal axis plot. Default 1. axis2 column X used vertical axis plot. Default 2. constraints list minx miny maxx maxy typically obtained  prettyGraphs::minmaxHelper(). NULL (default)  computed function prettyGraphs::minmaxHelper(). title title plots. col.points.color points/dots \(\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector needs exactly number items plotted. Default = 'blueviolet'. alpha.points.(default = .5), alpha (transparency) points, 1 (transparency) 0 (completely transparent). pch.character points \(\)-set. Default 19 (Circles). cex.size dots \(\)-set. Default = 2.5 segment.size.= 0, # size segment col.labels.color labels \(\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector, needs exactly number items plotted. Default =  'darkorchid'. alpha.labels.(default = 1), alpha (transparency) \(\)-labels, 1 (transparency) 0 (completely transparent). text.cex.= 4,  font size labels -set. font.face.(Default = 'bold', font labels \(\)-set. font.family.(Default = 'sans') font family \(\)-set. force.(Default = 1). much ggrepel repels labels  \(\)-set. col.points.j color points/dots \(J\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector needs exactly number items plotted. Default = 'darkolivegreen4'. alpha.points.j (default = .5), alpha (transparency) points, 1 (transparency) 0 (completely transparent). pch.j character points J-set. Default 18 (Diamonds). cex.j size dots \(J\)-set. Default = 2.5 segment.size.j = 0, # size segment \(J\)-set col.labels.j color labels \(J\)-set. Can one color vector colors. vector, needs exactly number items plotted. Default =  'darkolivegreen'. alpha.labels.j (default = 1), alpha (transparency) \(J\)-labels, 1 (transparency) 0 (completely transparent). text.cex.j (Default = 4),  font size labels J-set. font.face.j (Default = 'bold'), font labels \(J\)-set. font.family.j (Default = 'sans') font family \(J\)-set. force.j = 1. much ggrepel repels labels \(J\)-set. col.axes (Default = 'darkorchid') color axes alpha.axes (Default = .2) transoarency factors color axes. width.axes (Default = 1.1) width axes col.background Default = EmR1DIXvCW5OYYXM6vba6wp8n0eq53Hu-1- color background. nudge_x = 0. ggrepel, nudge value starting point labels: x dimension. nudge_y = 0. ggrepel, nudge value starting point labels: y dimension. ... everything else functions

what: Create nice labels for Factor Maps and other maps (must be ggplot2 graphs), for both the x and y axes at the same time. — createxyLabels.gen.digit
title: Create nice labels for Factor Maps and other maps (must be ggplot2 graphs), for both the x and y axes at the same time. — createxyLabels.gen.digit
text: Create nice labels Factor Maps maps (must ggplot2 graphs), x y axes time.

title: Create nice labels for Factor Maps and other maps (must be ggplot2 graphs), for both the x and y axes at the same time. — createxyLabels.gen.digit
code: createxyLabels.gen.digit(   x_axis = 1,   y_axis = 2,   lambda,   tau,   digit4lambda = 3,   digit4tau = 0,   axisName = "Dimension " )

title: Create nice labels for Factor Maps and other maps (must be ggplot2 graphs), for both the x and y axes at the same time. — createxyLabels.gen.digit
text: x_axis Dimension number x axis (default 1) ; y_axis Dimension number y axis (default 2) ; lambda Eigenvalues ; tau Percentage explained variances ; digit4lambda many digits displayed eigenvalues ; digit4tau many digits displayed percentages explained variances ; axisName Name axes (e.g. "Dimension", "Component").

title: Create nice labels for Factor Maps and other maps (must be ggplot2 graphs), for both the x and y axes at the same time. — createxyLabels.gen.digit
text: x y axis labels

title: Create nice labels for Factor Maps and other maps (must be ggplot2 graphs), for both the x and y axes at the same time. — createxyLabels.gen.digit
code: createxyLabels.gen.digit(lambda = 2:1, tau = 10*2:1) #> $x #> "Dimension " * 1 * ". " ~ ~lambda == 2 * . ~ ~tau == 20 * "%" #>  #> $y #> "Dimension " * 2 * ". " ~ ~lambda == 1 * . ~ ~tau == 10 * "%" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "labels"

what:
The causes of death are categorized according to the
``International Statistical Classification of Diseases
and Related Health Problems''.
In this data set, columns are the causes of death
(corresponding to chapters in the ICD nomenclature);
rows are age groups going from the youngest
age group being from 1 to 5 years old to the oldest ages group being
100 and over. — death2019

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis based on the
text: Sparse Correspondence Analysis based "projected Penalized Matrix Decomposition"

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis based on the
code: sCAwithPMD(   DATA,   dimensions = 2L,   doublecentering = TRUE,   s1 = rep(1, dimensions),   s2 = rep(1, dimensions) )

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis based on the
text: DATA times J contingency table dimensions, integer, number dimensions return (default 2) doublecentering, logical: data double-centered (default TRUE) s1, vector size 'dimensions" containing left side regularization parameters, coefficients vector belong interval 1, sqrt(), (default rep(1, dimensions)) s2, vector size 'dimensions" containing left side regularization parameters, coefficients vector belong interval 1, sqrt(J), (default rep(1, dimensions))

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis based on the
text: object containing necessary outputs sparse CA

title: Sparse Correspondence Analysis based on the
code: sCAwithPMD(HairEyeColor[,,1],dimensions = 3L, s1 = rep(0.5 * sqrt(dim(HairEyeColor)[1]), 3), rdsRight = rep(0.5 * sqrt(dim(HairEyeColor)[2]), 3)) #> Error in sCAwithPMD(HairEyeColor[, , 1], dimensions = 3L, s1 = rep(0.5 *     sqrt(dim(HairEyeColor)[1]), 3), rdsRight = rep(0.5 * sqrt(dim(HairEyeColor)[2]),     3)): unused argument (rdsRight = rep(0.5 * sqrt(dim(HairEyeColor)[2]), 3))

title: Reproducible code for the paper

title: Sparse Generalized Singular Value Decomposition — GPMD
code: GPMD(   X,   LW,   RW,   k = 0,   rdsLeft = rep(1, k),   rdsRight = rep(1, k),   tol.si = .Machine$double.eps )

title: Sparse Generalized Singular Value Decomposition — GPMD
text: X (data) matrix; LW PARAM_DESCRIPTION RW PARAM_DESCRIPTION k desired rank singular decomposition, Default: 0 rdsLeft radius (>0) $L_1$ ball left vector, Default: rep(1, k) rdsRight radius (>0) $L_1$ balls right vector, Default: rep(1, k) tol.si Tolerance computation Sparse Index, set default .Machine$double.eps
